Question: What is the role of <welcome-file-list> in the web.xml?:
Answer: <<<api>>>: <welcome-file-list>
<<<code>>>: <welcome-file-list>
    <welcome-file>index.html</welcome-file>
</welcome-file-list>
<<<explanation>>>: The <welcome-file-list> tag in the web.xml file is used to specify a list of files that should be served as the default page when a client requests a directory that does not contain a default page. In the provided code, "index.html" is specified as the default file for the directory.

Question: What is the role of <servlet> in the web.xml?:
Answer: <<<api>>>: <servlet>
<<<code>>>: <servlet>
    <servlet-name>MyServlet</servlet-name>
    <servlet-class>com.example.MyServlet</servlet-class>
</servlet>
<<<explanation>>>: The <servlet> tag in the web.xml file is used to define a servlet. The servlet-name is a unique identifier for the servlet, and the servlet-class specifies the fully qualified class name of the servlet. In the provided code, a servlet named "MyServlet" is defined with the class "com.example.MyServlet".

Question: What is the role of <servlet-mapping> in the web.xml?:
Answer: <<<api>>>: <servlet-mapping>
<<<code>>>: <servlet-mapping>
    <servlet-name>MyServlet</servlet-name>
    <url-pattern>/myServlet</url-pattern>
</servlet-mapping>
<<<explanation>>>: The <servlet-mapping> tag in the web.xml file is used to map a URL pattern to a servlet. The servlet-name is the name of the servlet to be mapped, and the url-pattern is the URL pattern that the servlet will respond to. In the provided code, the servlet named "MyServlet" will respond to requests at the URL pattern "/myServlet".

Question: What is the role of <session-config> in the web.xml?:
Answer: <<<api>>>: <session-config>
<<<code>>>: <session-config>
    <session-timeout>30</session-timeout>
</session-config>
<<<explanation>>>: The <session-config> tag in the web.xml file is used to configure session management for the web application. The session-timeout element specifies the number of minutes that a session will remain active between client accesses. In the provided code, the session will timeout after 30 minutes of inactivity.

Question: What is the role of <mime-mapping> in the web.xml?:
Answer: <<<api>>>: <mime-mapping>
<<<code>>>: <mime-mapping>
    <extension>html</extension>
    <mime-type>text/html</mime-type>
</mime-mapping>
<<<explanation>>>: The <mime-mapping> tag in the web.xml file is used to map a file extension to a MIME type. This is important for specifying the type of content that a file contains, which browsers use to handle the content appropriately. In the provided code, the ".html" file extension is mapped to the "text/html" MIME type, which tells the browser to handle the content as HTML.

Question: What is the role of <error-page> in the web.xml?:
Answer: <<<api>>>: <error-page>
<<<code>>>: <error-page>
    <error-code>404</error-code>
    <location>/error.html</location>
</error-page>
